channel.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
channel.description:
...so I thought it would be good to have a discussion on the man himself: Adolf Hitler.
Some say he was an evil man. Others say he was a good leader, and that he brought significant economic and social growth to germany. His arguably unethical human experiments advanced modern science significantly, and expanded our knowledge of clinical depression such that we now consider it to be a diagnosable condition that millions of people around the world suffer with. I'm fairly impartial on the subject - I don't know much about what he did, so I'd like to know what you think about the man.
Other than that, I think now would be a good time to wish him a Happy Birthday from all of us at moparscape. I believe that every child of god has the right to be wished a happy birthday, and that they should retain a certain level of dignity when they are not able to defend themselves in the flesh.

item.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:31, topic:542376”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=661253.msg4420314#msg4420314 date=1398078818]
I think you’re all missing the point. Nothing can justify killing one person nor ~six million (as per modern estimate).
[/quote]

So I guess you shouldn’t visit MT. Washington, or go to any of the tallest buildings in the world, heck don’t even go the hoover dam, why because people died to create those. Why visit a place where people died just so you could enjoy your self, you may also want to leave the U.S.A because remember people died for it.[/quote]

Don’t forget that his trainers were most likely made in a sweatshop.

Read full topic
item.source: Today is the birthday of a great political leader

item.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Pure_:

You’re still glorifying him, hence the rise of neo-Nazism.

I’m sorry, did you just accuse me of instigating neo-Nazism? You delirious piece of shit! Neo-Nazism where? I’ve never had an indepth discussion about the Nazis in real life (it’s close to impossible because there is always someone who covers their ears and just repeats “any discussion of Hitler is glorification”). There are also rarely discussions on the MoparScape forums due to moderators not allowing discussion of it.

Pure_:

For the record, most of my arguments are bias because I do not tolerate the spreading of anything that even seems pro-Nazi. I disagree with such ideology wholeheartedly and that’s why I’m upset by such posts and thus my further moderation which seems a personal vendetta.

Are you trolling? I hope you are, because if not you are looking like a moron. If you accept that your arguments are biased, and you’re not willing to have a proper discussion on a discussion thread without acting childish, then leave this topic and go somewhere else. We’ve already explained why we don’t believe that Hitler was inherently evil; that is not a pro-Nazi viewpoint but instead is a pro-human viewpoint. No one on Earth, past nor present, is completely good or evil - saying the same about Hitler does not make me a pro-Nazi.

If you’re unable to hold a mature, composed and adult discussion on the matter then go somewhere else.

Read full topic
item.source: Today is the birthday of a great political leader

item.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:28, topic:542376”]he didn’t just kill the Jews in ways to punish them for no reason whatsoever. he essentially used them as human guinea pigs for science.[/quote]The physicians carried out the experiments, he just told them what he wanted (ie, find out a way to survive extreme cold), as did he to all his contemporaries.

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:27, topic:542376”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=661253.msg4420317#msg4420317 date=1398079458]

I think you’re all missing the point. Nothing can justify killing one person nor ~six million (as per modern estimate).

I think you’re also missing the point. No one is attempting to justify it.

If a newspaper writes “the serial killer, today sentenced to life in prison, was severely abused as a child”, do you get up in arms about how “nothing justifies murder!!!”? I’d hope not, because that’s not attempting to justify it, it is (partly) explaining it. If you can’t take part in a sensible and civil discussion without placing your fingers in your ears and shouting as loud as you can, fudge off and find another topic. This isn’t the topic for childish behaviour.

I’m not saying what Hitler did wasn’t evil. I’m saying that he didn’t do it just to be evil. He was trying to better Germany, he didn’t skulk around in blood-covered lederhosen thinking about how to get into the League of Supervillains.
[/quote]
Somewhere in his brain he would have known what he was doing was bad, unless he was mentally ill. If he was trying to better Germany then why did he bother torturing the Jews? Why did he bother keeping them alive in concentration camps to starve, spread sickness to each other and eventually die from torture? Why not just exterminate the Jews right away and move on to the next? He didn’t do these things because he thought he was doing Germany a favor, I think it was because he was a just sick person who had the power to embrace his own beliefs. He believed everyone that wasn’t Nordic was inferior and his actions speak on his behalf. I had a quick look around and it seems as if Hitler did very little for Germany, besides provide jobs and apparently put poverty on a halt (remember this was to his benefit). He made irrational decisions that lead to the loss of battles and soldiers that continued all the way up to his death.[/quote]You’re still glorifying him, hence the rise of neo-Nazism.

As for Tabby, he did better Germany in many ways and ruined it in others. It’s not black and white, but overall he ended up crushing their economy (post-war), un-doing most of what he “achieved” and cost them great humiliation (the German people are very patriotic/nationalistic, it’s one of the reason why WW2 was even able to occur). One possible explanation as to his hatred of jews is his miniscule (and his mentors) involvement in the Thule Society. Another is the fictitious The Protocols of the Elders of Zion which I recall him having read, incorporated into German education and even notes it in his book, Mein Kampf.

For the record, most of my arguments are bias because I do not tolerate the spreading of anything that even seems pro-Nazi. I disagree with such ideology wholeheartedly and that’s why I’m upset by such posts and thus my further moderation which seems a personal vendetta.

Read full topic
item.source: Today is the birthday of a great political leader

I think you’re all missing the point. Nothing can justify killing one person nor ~six million (as per modern estimate).
[/quote]

I think you’re also missing the point. No one is attempting to justify it.

If a newspaper writes “the serial killer, today sentenced to life in prison, was severely abused as a child”, do you get up in arms about how “nothing justifies murder!!!”? I’d hope not, because that’s not attempting to justify it, it is (partly) explaining it. If you can’t take part in a sensible and civil discussion without placing your fingers in your ears and shouting as loud as you can, fudge off and find another topic. This isn’t the topic for childish behaviour.

I’m not saying what Hitler did wasn’t evil. I’m saying that he didn’t do it just to be evil. He was trying to better Germany, he didn’t skulk around in blood-covered lederhosen thinking about how to get into the League of Supervillains.[/quote]
Somewhere in his brain he would have known what he was doing was bad, unless he was mentally ill. If he was trying to better Germany then why did he bother torturing the Jews? Why did he bother keeping them alive in concentration camps to starve, spread sickness to each other and eventually die from torture? Why not just exterminate the Jews right away and move on to the next? He didn’t do these things because he thought he was doing Germany a favor, I think it was because he was a just sick person who had the power to embrace his own beliefs. He believed everyone that wasn’t Nordic was inferior and his actions speak on his behalf. I had a quick look around and it seems as if Hitler did very little for Germany, besides provide jobs and apparently put poverty on a halt (remember this was to his benefit). He made irrational decisions that lead to the loss of battles and soldiers that continued all the way up to his death.

item.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:23, topic:542376”]#Now that we have had our history lesson for the day lol…

I think it’s fairly simple to understand what I meant I wasn’t meaning to start a " what did Hitler actually do" topic. What most people will relate to Hitler are the bad sides. Example, I actually did know that he was a staunch anti smoker but it doesn’t mean that everyone else is going to give two hoots about that. They are going to see him for the wrongs he has committed.[/quote]

Of course, Hitler committed atrocities. However, as Vain said, Hitler was not a comic book villain. He did what he did in pursuit of greatness for Germany, he did not do it to be evil.

Read full topic

item.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:20, topic:542376”]Adolf may had never did anything that was “good” for Germany, or any other country ( albeit besides dying ) but even I have to admit he was a wonderful public speaker.

Happy Birthday Adolf. Make sure to pick a giant pineapple for the occasion to get shoved up your ass in whatever type of hell you are probably in.

/inb4 religion
/inb4 movie fanatic[/quote]

To say he never did anything good for anyone is incorrect (unless you see good/bad as a scale, and his bad actions “cancel” his good ones).

[ul][li]Nazi Germany was worried about animal conservation, and introduced hunting laws to protect animals (especially those native to Germany).[/li]
[li]They gained a lot of medical information, especially hypothermia (although unfortunately this was gained through human experimentation).[/li]
[li]Ever wore Adidas shoes, or other pieces of clothing? You have Adolf “Adi” Dassler to thank for that. If you’ve ever wore Puma, you have Rudolf Dassler to thank. Both brothers were members of the Nazi party.[/li]
[li]What about Werner Von Braun, who helped create the Saturn V rocket which placed man on the moon?
[/li][li]What do you think about the Volkswagen Beetle? Hitler himself said that it should look like a Beetle.[/li]
[li]In World War I, Hitler achieved two iron crosses for bravery - is that not a “good thing” for Germany?[/li]
[li]Nazi doctors were the first to write a scientific paper linking smoking to lung cancer. Hitler was a staunch anti-smoker.[/li]
[li]Thanks to the 1933 Farm Law farms were assured sales and given subsidies.[/li]
[li]The KdF organisation provided cut-price leisure activities for German workers, regardless of class.[/li][/ul]

The Nazis committed atrocities. The Holocaust was one of the worst things, if not the worst thing to happen in the history of humanity. Hitler was the leader of the Nazis, and as such was responsible for the atrocities committed. However, to say that neither the Nazi Party nor Adolf Hitler did anything “good” for the people of Germany or the people of modern society is pure ignorance.

Read full topic
item.source: Today is the birthday of a great political leader

item.title: Today is the birthday of a great political leader
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:14, topic:542376”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=661253.msg4420181#msg4420181 date=1398041867]
I find it hard to take anything on tumblr seriously after seeing this:

[/quote]so nothing on a site full of millions of people isn’t credible due to one troll?

[quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=661253.msg4420183#msg4420183 date=1398042658]
One countries rise to luxury doesn’t justify the death of millions. Case closed.
[/quote]nobody said it justified anything. perhaps you didn’t read the full postings, or maybe you just didn’t grasp what is was saying. his decisions were not good ones, nor should they be forgotten or forgiven - but he didn’t do them, just to do them. he did not go out of his way to kill people just because. he, in his mind, believed he was bettering his own people. the same could be said for what obama is doing. many believe he is a horrible leader and his decisions are poor, but he believes he is bettering us. does this make him a horrible leader? no. hitler wasn’t a bad leader. just a bad person.[/quote]Agreed. Jeff Bezos said that all people have good intentions, and although the reason he said this was to support a point about improving quality control mechanisms, I think it is a true fact. I didn’t personally know Hitler, but I feel as though he had good intentions and he certainly achieved most of his objectives. He didn’t do it for personal gain - he did it for the (perceived) betterment of his country and humanity.

Read full topic

This is a discussion forum and this is a perfectly legitimate discussion. If people have an issue with this to the extent that they can’t read his name then they ought not to click this thread again.
[/quote]What is the question? All I see is a happy birthday thread honouring a delusional sociopathic killer (by even considering him a person).

OP: YES INJECTING DYE INTO PEOPLES EYES HAVE HELPED US A LOT!!! PLACING PRISONERS INTO ICE TANKS FOR HOURS HAVE HELPED US A LOT TOO!!! GASING MILLIONS HAS DEFINITELY HELPED SCIENCE!!

Dipshits like you give pro-Nazis excuses and they continue to defend the holocaust until the day they die (as per holocaust denial, etc.). You are an enabler, and your disgusting regime of immorality will end soon. No tyrant is safe.

Are you Jewish or something because only Jews get as butthurt as you over this topic.
[/quote]Does that make my point invalid? You’re the biggest fudgeing retard on this forum, yet you don’t see me bitching about the dumb shit you post (not on the forums anyway).[/quote]
